New Records: Chris Paul became the third player in the NBA history with 12,000 career assists, joining John Stockton and Jason Kidd in this elite company.
Key Match Events: Chris Paul achieved the historical assist in the first quarter of the game with a lob for Victor Wembanyama.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Paul expressed his achievement in joining the elite company of players with 12,000 career assists.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chris Paul is currently averaging 10.3 points, 3.8 rebounds, 8.6 assists, and 1.3 steals per game, shooting 46.3% from the field, 37.1% from three, and a perfect 100% from the free-throw line.
Others: The Los Angeles Lakers won against the San Antonio Spurs with a final score of 120-115.
